image.altText: Three politicians sit behind a desk, while a video call is shown on a screen.

props.synopsis: Representatives of the Jewish community and Australian National Imams Council front a snap parliamentary hearing called to probe Labor's legislative response to the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: 'Just get rid of it': Call to scrap religious text carve-out in hate laws

image.altText: A close up shot of the face of Donald Trump, who is wearing a hat with the word USA on it.

props.synopsis: The Iranian regime has done exactly what Donald Trump warned against. Despite the information blackout, it is clear hundreds, if not thousands, of protesters have died and the US president is now likely to order a response, writes John Lyons.

title.children: It is now very likely Trump will order his military option of choice on Iran

image.altText: A close up of a man with black round glasses and short grey hair with green background

props.synopsis: As the Adelaide Festival director reveals he had urged the festival's board not to cancel Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, a former board member opens up about his very different concerns about the Adelaide Writers' Week program.

title.children: Festival director warned board about Writers' Week fallout

image.altText: Kazem Kaz Hamad at what appears to be a boxing ring with two people who's faces are blurred out.

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke says he believes tobacco kingpin Kaz Hamad thought he was "out of reach" of authorities before his arrest in Iraq.

title.children: Captured tobacco kingpin thought 'he was out of reach', says Burke

image.altText: A boy faces a teacher who is standing in front of a blackboard.

props.synopsis: Hackers have accessed the emails, passwords and names of past and present students from all Victorian government schools in a major data breach.

title.children: Hackers access student emails, passwords in major school data breach

image.altText: The wind whips up embers as the Palisades fire burns during a windstorm on the west side of Los Angeles.

props.synopsis: Extreme heat, droughts, storms and deadly floods challenged resilience not only in Australia, but across the globe.

title.children: What life was like in 2025 across the planet in a changing climate

image.altText: An Islamic cleric wearing traditional robes and headgear speaks into a mic.

props.synopsis: The comments from Iran's judiciary chief come as activists warn that protesters detained during demonstrations in Iran could soon be hanged.

title.children: Iran judiciary signals fast executions for protesters

image.altText: A black and white image shows the Grok image logo which says 'Grok' next to a stylised black box

props.synopsis: New laws in the UK that would outlaw the generation of sexual deepfakes are set to come into force this week.

title.children: X to change AI chatbot after outrage over sexual deepfake images

image.altText: Dozens of rescue workers stand by a wrecked train carriage

props.synopsis: A crane used to construct an elevated high-speed railway has fallen onto a moving train travelling from Bangkok to Ubon Ratchathani province, officials say.

title.children: At least 31 killed after crane falls on Thai passenger train

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt smiles widely holding a silver trophy

props.synopsis: Sydneysider Jordan Smith has beaten grand slam champion Jannik Sinner and dual grand slam finalist Amanda Anasimova to take home the prize in the novelty format.

title.children: 'Can't speak': Tennis battler beats the pros to take home $1 million jackpot

image.altText: An aerial photo showing land burnt and land not burnt

props.synopsis: Victoria's bushfires have now burnt across 404,000 hectares, or a total area more than five times the size of Singapore.

title.children: More than 220 homes now confirmed lost in Victorian bushfires

image.altText: A picture of an snow outcrop on the coast of Greenland.

props.synopsis: Greenlandic and Danish foreign ministers will meet US Vice-President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Washington after the US renews threats to take control of the Arctic island.

title.children: Trump says US needs Greenland for purpose of national security

image.altText: Ship near Antarctic ice.

props.synopsis: Australian authorities say they are "investigating all the options available" to assist a search operation for a diver missing in Antarctica.

title.children: Search underway for missing diver in Antarctica

image.altText: Farmer with his dog on a farm, smiling

props.synopsis: Amid the damage from flooding in Central Queensland, tales of livestock surviving are emerging, including one cow's incredible waterlogged journey.

title.children: Cow survives 80km swim in floodwater before washing ashore on beach

image.altText: Craig wears a blue long sleeve top and rests his head in the palm of his hands as he smiles

props.synopsis: The fallout of the high-profile child exploitation material allegations against Craig Silvey starts to ripple through the literary community, as the renowned author faces charges of possessing and distributing illicit material.

title.children: Shops pull Craig Silvey's books off shelves in response to charges

image.altText: Electric bikes being crushed by heavy machinery.

props.synopsis: Police charge 25 youths and seize and destroy dozens of electric scooters and off-road bikes in a targeted crackdown on e-rideables in Perth's northern suburbs.

title.children: 'Unacceptable': Juveniles charged, e-rideables crushed in police crackdown

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt with black hair stands in front of a pile of donation items in a room.

props.synopsis: Op shops ask people to be mindful of what they donate following an influx of donations over the new year.

title.children: Op shops are calling for people to think before they donate

image.altText: Young man placing a transparent plastic container of food into the microwave.

props.synopsis: Researchers say there are some simple ways to help minimise our exposure to the microplastics and nanoplastics in our homes.

title.children: Air-drying laundry, wooden chopping boards: Reducing exposure to microplastics at home

image.altText: Alyssa Healy smiles

props.synopsis: After calling time on her decorated 15-year career, a spell in media commentary looks inevitable for Australian cricket star Alyssa Healy.

title.children: 'She watches a lot more cricket than I do': Healy taken aback by commentary praise

image.altText: environment minister murray watt

props.synopsis: Federal Environment Minister Murray Watt has rejected a cultural heritage claim on the site of Brisbane's Olympic stadium, and has appointed an independent facilitator to mediate between interested parties.

title.children: Cultural claim over key Brisbane Olympic site knocked back

image.altText: Bondi Beach bridge three weeks after terrorist attack.

props.synopsis: The Bondi Beach footbridge that some locals want removed following last month's terror attack was already going to need replacement for structural reasons.

title.children: Minns says Bondi bridge should be torn down, not become 'ghoulish reminder'

image.altText: A police boat moored at a marina.

props.synopsis: Police search for a boat worth about $140,000 that was stolen from the Sunshine Coast after its keys were left on board while the owners were overseas on holiday.

title.children: Police baffled by 'strange' $140k boat theft

image.altText: An Australian Rules Football with the AFL logo on the middle

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man who had "had enough" after becoming the target of "pranks" by kids, had hoarded "hundreds" of footballs kicked into his yard from the neighbouring school, a court hears.

title.children: Man hoarded 'hundreds' of footballs kicked over fence, court hears

image.altText: Poppy crop up close

props.synopsis: The theft of a "significant quantity" of medicinal-grade poppies could result in a "life-threatening" situation if they are ingested in pursuit of a high, Tasmanian authorities warn.

title.children: Poppy thieves warned of 'life-threatening' danger

image.altText: An old photograph of a young girl

props.synopsis: As police up the reward to $1 million for information that will lead to the remains of missing school girl Eloise Worledge, questions remain about why police disregarded a known rapist in their investigation.

title.children: The man police overlooked in Eloise Worledge disappearance

image.altText: A small boat in the ocean.

props.synopsis: The men will serve four months in prison after being caught off the WA coast with 40 kilograms of sea cucumber and an array of fishing gear.

title.children: Indonesian fishermen jailed after repeat offences in Australian waters

image.altText: A pipe bomb outside on the ground

props.synopsis: Police are urging Canberrans not to touch suspicious objects after pipe bombs were discovered in Belconnen.

title.children: 'Dangerous' pipe bombs found on Canberra footpaths

image.altText: A picture of a woman sitting with a table behind her

props.synopsis: Velvet Pesu was found dead at a house in Logan on Monday while police were conducting a welfare check.

title.children: Police issue arrest warrant over alleged murder of Brisbane carer

image.altText: An aerial view of a container terminal in Shanghai, China

props.synopsis: A shift away from the United States toward South-East Asia, Africa and Latin America has helped Chinese exports remain strong.

title.children: China reports record $US1.2 trillion trade surplus despite Trump trade war

image.altText: thumbnail people gather alaeddin market

props.synopsis: The first embers of the Iranian protests started in a mobile phone market, spreading to every corner of the country as the Revolutionary Guard struggled to regain control.

title.children: Rare verified footage of Iran's protests shows how they spread

image.altText: man with moustache and beard, sunglasses, and baseball cap wears a beige short sleeve shirt stands in front of a white truck

props.synopsis: Some Indian truck drivers have copped so much racist abuse they have stopped using their CB radios.

title.children: Indian truckies fed up with racist tirades over their CB radios

image.altText: A man in a white shirt and suit smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: The ABC can reveal a neurosurgeon specialising in spinal surgery is among five people facing serious charges over a Queensland scheme allegedly involving kickbacks for medical devices.

title.children: Brisbane neurosurgeon charged over alleged medical devices kickback scheme

image.altText: Tom Silvagni, whose name was suppressed throughout his criminal proceedings, pictured in a suit outside court.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for convicted rapist Tom Silvagni, the son of AFL great Stephen Silvagni and TV personality Jo Silvagni, have filed an application for leave to appeal.

title.children: Tom Silvagni files application to appeal rape conviction

image.altText: Bankstown prayer hall

props.synopsis: A controversial prayer hall in south-west Sydney linked to notorious Islamic preacher Wisam Haddad has announced it will permanently close.

title.children: Sydney prayer hall linked to notorious preacher to close down

image.altText: A boy being led out of a helicopter by authorities.

props.synopsis: Bohdi Jackson was meant to complete an 8-kilometre run on Tuesday. After taking a wrong turn, he ended up travelling 50km, sparking a large search.

title.children: Rescued teen craves 'choccy milk' after running 50km lost in mountains
